Name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Description: Provides the largest collection of on-demand cloud computing resources, APIs, and managed services.

Name: Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Description: Offers scalable public cloud infrastructure and specialized services for data analytics and containerization.

Name: Microsoft Azure
Description: Provides cloud services built for enterprise, hybrid, and proprietary systems integration.

Name: DigitalOcean
Description: Provides virtual private servers (Droplets) and managed infrastructure with a focus on simplicity and ease of use.

Name: Linode (Akamai)
Description: Offers high-performance Linux virtual machines (VMs) and supporting cloud infrastructure.

Name: Vercel
Description: Offers high-performance Linux virtual machines (VMs) and supporting cloud infrastructure.

Name: Netlify
Description: A platform for static sites and serverless functions, featuring automatic build and deployment from Git.

Name: GitHub Pages
Description: A static site hosting service integrated directly with Git repositories for simple web publishing.

Name: Hostinger
Description: Provides budget-focused shared hosting, managed WordPress, and virtual private server packages.

Name: EAS Hosting
Description: A service integrated with Expo Application Services for deploying web projects, API routes, and server functions to the edge network (Cloudflare Workers).

Name: Supabase
Description: An open-source Backend-as-a-Service (BaaS) that provides managed PostgreSQL, Auth, and real-time APIs.

Name: Heroku
Description: A managed Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) that handles server operations, allowing focus on code deployment.

Name: Firebase
Description: Google's BaaS offering for web and mobile development, including NoSQL database and authentication.
Service Area: BaaS, Containers, DB Provider, Deployment, PaaS

Name: Render
Description: A unified cloud platform for hosting web services, databases, and Docker containers with automatic scaling.

Name: MongoDB Atlas
Description: The official cloud service for managed MongoDB (NoSQL) document databases.

Name: PlanetScale
Description: A serverless MySQL platform offering sharding, scalability, and non-blocking database branching.

Name: Neon
Description: A serverless PostgreSQL solution designed for cost-efficiency by separating storage and compute.

Name: Twilio
Description: Provides APIs for programmatic communication including SMS, Voice, and Video services.

Name: Redis Cloud
Description: The managed service for the high-performance Redis Key-Value and in-memory data structure store.

Name: SendGrid
Description: An API specializing in the reliable delivery of transactional and marketing emails.

Name: Stripe
Description: A platform for developers to accept and manage online payments, subscriptions, and payouts.

Name: Auth0
Description: An identity management platform that provides authentication and authorization services via API.

Name: Google Maps Platform
Description: Provides APIs for integrating detailed maps, location data, and routing services into applications.

Name: Algolia
Description: An API that provides instant, typo-tolerant search-as-a-service for applications.

Name: Datadog
Description: A unified platform for monitoring, logging, and performance metrics across the entire application stack.

Name: Sentry
Description: Real-time error tracking and performance monitoring for capturing and analyzing application exceptions and crashes.

Name: Infinityfree
Description: A provider offering completely free, basic shared web hosting with support for PHP and MySQL.
